abstract: Longtime shareholders, some of them families that owned Bank of America’s legacy banks, are alarmed by the daunting challenges confronting the company.
snippet: Longtime shareholders, some of them families that owned Bank of America’s legacy banks, are alarmed by the daunting challenges confronting the company.
lead_paragraph: For more than 70 years, through good times and bad, the Eliasberg family stood by their bank. Their tiny lender grew up to become part of what is now Bank of America  tying the family’s fortunes to that of the nation’s largest bank.

headline.main: Investors Air Discontent With Bank of America
headline.print_headline: Investors Air Discontent With Bank Of America

abstract: For more than 70 years, through good times and bad, the Eliasberg family stood by their bank. Their tiny lender grew up to become part of what is now Bank of America — tying the family’s fortunes to that of the nation’s largest bank.
lead_paragraph: For more than 70 years, through good times and bad, the Eliasberg family stood by their bank. Their tiny lender grew up to become part of what is now Bank of America — tying the family’s fortunes to that of the nation’s largest bank.

headline.main: Investors Air Discontent With Bank of America

abstract: The bank said its $4.2 billion profit showed the value of acquiring Merrill Lynch and Countrywide, but its shares fell because much of the profit came from accounting changes.
snippet: The bank said its $4.2 billion profit showed the value of acquiring Merrill Lynch and Countrywide, but its shares fell because much of the profit came from accounting changes.
lead_paragraph: After a strong rally lifted financial stocks 80 percent in just six weeks, Wall Street is once again becoming nervous about the big banks.

headline.main: Profit Up, Bank of America Chief Cites Acquisitions
headline.print_headline: Bank Report Fails to Stem New Unease In Markets

byline.original: By Jack Healy and Louise Story

abstract: Anxious shareholders got a bit of good news on Monday from Bank of America, which reported that its first-quarter net income more than tripled, The New York Times said.
lead_paragraph: Anxious shareholders got a bit of good news on Monday from Bank of America, which reported that its first-quarter net income more than tripled, The New York Times said.

headline.main: Quarter Offers Some Good News for Bank of America

abstract: Worries on Wall Street that the toll of the recession and last fall’s financial crisis will spread to the earnings of industrial companies, retailers and others.
snippet: Worries on Wall Street that the toll of the recession and last fall’s financial crisis will spread to the earnings of industrial companies, retailers and others.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street’s nagging fears about the financial system resurfaced on Monday, pushing stocks sharply lower. Even as the banking giant Bank of America posted big profits, investors fretted about losses and other write-downs that could be lurking.

headline.main: A New Round of Worries Pushes Shares Lower
headline.print_headline: A New Round of Worries Pushes Shares Lower
